intro: Lychnis atsaensis, commonly known as the Atsaense campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
